block.p: Maxine Elizabeth Goldstein, the daughter of Mark Goldstein of New York and the late Marilyn Goldstein, was married last evening to Berkeley Hynes, the son of Shirley and John Hynes of Toronto. Rabbi Alon Levkovitz officiated at the Wölffer Estate Vineyard in Sagaponack, N.Y.

Mrs. Hynes, 27, is to receive an M.B.A. from the University of Toronto this week. In October, she is scheduled to start work in Toronto as a strategy consultant at Bain and Company, the management consulting firm based in Boston. She graduated cum laude from Dartmouth.

Maxine Elizabeth Goldstein, the daughter of Mark Goldstein of New York and the late Marilyn Goldstein, was married last evening to Berkeley Hynes, the son of Shirley and John Hynes of Toronto. Rabbi Alon Levkovitz officiated at the Wölffer Estate Vineyard in Sagaponack, N.Y.

Maxine Elizabeth Goldstein, the daughter of Mark Goldstein of New York and the late Marilyn Goldstein, was married last evening to Berkeley Hynes, the son of Shirley and John Hynes of Toronto. Rabbi Alon Levkovitz officiated at the Wölffer Estate Vineyard in Sagaponack, N.Y.

Mrs. Hynes, 27, is to receive an M.B.A. from the University of Toronto this week. In October, she is scheduled to start work in Toronto as a strategy consultant at Bain and Company, the management consulting firm based in Boston. She graduated cum laude from Dartmouth.
Her father, who is retired, was a partner and managing director of Neuberger Berman, an investment management company in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Amy Tunis.

Mr. Hynes, 30, is a vice president in the Toronto office of Citigroup, where he markets derivative securities to corporate clients. He graduated from McGill University in Montreal and received a law degree and an M.B.A. from the University of Toronto.

His parents work in Toronto, where his mother is a program administrator of adult education at the Toronto Catholic District School Board and his father is a senior trust officer at a division of Toronto-Dominion Bank.
